analysis.key_quote: The proposed amendments of the civil service regulations related to Schedule F positions seek to abolish the merit system which is a core feature of the federal civil service as envisioned by the Pendleton Act since they seek to convert non-partisan career civil servants into political appointees subject to the whims of the political party in power.
analysis.rationale: The comment explicitly opposes the proposed rule by highlighting concerns about the erosion of the merit-based system and the potential for politicization of the civil service, which aligns with the themes of merit-based system concerns and politicization concerns.
